snippet: The owner of an Internet cafe in southwest China was given an eight-year prison term for criticizing the ruling Communists in online messages.
abstract: Cao Haibo, owner of Internet cafe in southwest China, is given an eight-year prison term for criticizing the ruling Communists in online messages and for seeking to establish an opposition party.
lead_paragraph: The owner of an Internet cafe in southwest China was given an eight-year prison term for criticizing the ruling Communists in online messages.

headline.seo: China: Cafe Owner Sentenced Over Online Messages
headline.main: China: Cafe Owner Sentenced Over Online Messages
headline.print_headline: China: Cafe Owner Sentenced Over Online Messages
